comments.body: Agreed. I'm surprised they didn't add one when the aquatic update released. It was a perfect time. I also think the disc color should be an aqua color kinda like how pigstep is red since its in the nether.
you know the ocean is like a whole another dimension at this point.
Interesting idea, but it would probably be impossible technically without being a separate enchantment
That would be to over powered
it actually can be done using command blocks today

This post is even more true with the new Caves & Cliffs update. 1.18 has left us with mountains of dirt. When you look at a mountain from the group it looks ugly, like a big brown pile of... dirt.

A full grass block would create grassy mountains and create a richer aesthetic.

Still agree that there should be an all grass block to provide better immersion and visuals. When I go outside and look at a hill I don't see the dirt, I still see grass along its face so I wish that could be represented.
You're absolutely right. I want green hills not brown!!

There could be an underground biome with pools of this toxic water. This suggestion is actually quite cool because if it poisons you down to half a heart, one hit from an aggressive fish or something could kill you.
If they do the cave update, they should have this

Alot of people like using elytra's but the fact that it doesn't let anyone see the chestplate is annoying

People have asked for you to allow elytra and armour

I am aware you have declined it saying it would be OP

So my idea is a vanity slot

You gain no benifit from it, it just makes players look alot nicer

I think there should be a way to automatically place lava into cauldrons and a hopper with one slot or a way to only allow one type of item to pass through these things would make things alot easier for the redstone community
I totally agree with this. Imagine a new disc for the Caves and Cliffs update.
I'm thinking of composing a track for the Caves and Cliffs Update called "Highs and Lows" which is meant to be a comforting song and that everything's gonna be alright.
They should feature guest composers like they did with Lena Raine and Pigstep
well it's easy enough to say the fletching table needs functionality, but what would it do?
The fletching table could let you craft all possible storage block types with your inventory materials in a GUI. Iron ingots to iron blocks, coal to coal blocks etc...

Fletching table idea: Placing Gravel in a fletching table will convert 2 Gravel to 1 flint, for people who don't wish to use Fortune Shovels and/or have hundreds of blocks of gravel.

Placing string and a bow/crossbow would repair the weapon.

Crafting arrows gives you +50% More (6 arrows, instead of 4).

• Pillows are blocks as high as slabs.
  • you build with them like with slabs.
  • There should be 16 different colors.
  • Pillows reduce the fall damage. You can stack these:

                     1 pillow 22%, 2 pillows 45%,  3 pillows 68%,  4 pillows 91% (e.g.)

  • Pillows are obtained in which a colored wool is combined with 8 feathers. This gives the feathers a little more meaning.
  • Pillows can be combined with beds. There are already interesting ideas for this.
  • Otherwise, cushions have similar properties to wool. Walking is maybe slower and you may always stand a little lower (similar to soul sand)
  • How should she look? I don't know, but different from slabs!
Cool, I like pillows!
Could call it a "propel block".
This should be in the Redstone section.
launch pad maybe?
ok but tbh i think ejector block sounds better
You can do this with slime blocks. Put one on a sticky piston and power it and it will shoot you upwards (I haven’t tried it sideways but it probably will work).
I know you can do that, and it does work sideways, but it is very difficult so this would be helpful in that situation.
Maybe depending on the signal strength could control how far and fast the entity will move in a given direction?
Maybe depending on the signal strength could control how far and fast the entity will move in a given direction?
Interesting idea! I would love to use this in my redstone builds
Honestly that’s a bit too much damage compared to the resources. Maybe if you can only naturally find it in chests it can be a bit more balanced.
It would be really cool if you could put potions effects on them, like poisoning, but he need to be more balanced
What if you could enchant it (such as loyalty, sharpness, etc) but naturally, it did about as much damage as a trident, maybe

Perhaps it is suitable to give him long-range attack characteristics, something like sword gas but not sword gas!
Because he should be heavy and attack slowly

If you want to compensate for the high damage you could make it the recipe of a pickaxe mixed with the axe recipe so that it can also be made with all of the different materials as well (wood, stone, iron, gold, diamond, and netherite). The damage could change based off of those too.
Wouldn’t that just be white glass though?
Another transparent block would be great!
I would suggest maybe adding different types of quartz. Like rose quartz ect. Those are translucent plus add some texture and color.

Translucent quartz would look like a real-life quartz crystal but would not be completely clear. One side would be cloudy while the other side would be completely see-through. So it's like a car window tinted black. The people outside would not be able to see what's on the inside. You can see it clearly on the inside of the car. The same with translucent quartz.
great idea, I'd like to have a glass-like thing in my pure nether survival

Exactly. If you want to live in the nether without going in the overworld you wouldn't have glass to see outside. Of course, you can have a fence or just a hole to see outside from your base but it wouldn't look as nice in my personal opinion. It would be the Nethers glass. I think you would be able to tint it with dye too. Just like stained glass.
I think Just cooking quartz blocks into glass works fine

A very intruiging idea.
Personally, I like the challenge of having to find an end city and taking down shulkers to get shulker boxes.
I also don't think the Ender man thing makes much sense.
But!
It would bring much needed use to chorus and ender crystals.
So!
I propose that the precursor block, crafted with an end crystal, two purpur blocks, four shulker shells and two endstone bricks, teleports away if hit by the player (the only way to pick it up would be with silk touch pick) but in its place it leaves a shulker mob.
To put endermen into the mix, they would be attracted to the blocks and want to pick them up, but the precursor would teleports away if they try to. Farm possibilities are here.
To stop it from being to op, the block can only teleport three times. But it can be refuelled if right clicked with a chorus fruit to give it another three teleports. This can also be done by a dispenser. But the block can only be refuelled four times, each time changing the appearance of the block to look more cracked, and increasing the distance it can teleport, because its more "unstable".
Also the precursor block cn be placed by dispensers, much like shulker boxes. And they only teleport in the end. 
This all means that shulkers can be farmable, but only with a chorus farm and also some considerable endstone mining
but.... why?
Interesting, could it like a barnacle so it is very visible
magma cubes?
396593778771 I think he's going for more of a super mario bros. lava bubble type thing, and not trying to add another mobile threat like magma cubes.

omg that is what i thought about! it can be a mob that walks in lava seas and follows players. throwing items in it will heal it. it also may moan and howl (like it is a suffering soul or something). i agree that lava is much more manageable now so this kind of obstacle would be cool. imagine coming closer to lava lakes and suddenly it spawns

I 100% agree. Soul Speed Using Durability pretty much ruins the purpose of getting the enchantment. The only remotely feasible way to work around it would be to have two boots, one with soul speed and one without, which is a major inconvenience for players gathering resources

yes pleeeeeaaaase remove the durability. it will be a real pain to have to keep checking it and repairing it. we already have to do that with elytra. at least elytra makes sense. but boots that break while you wear them? nah im not using them
If soul speed didn't have durability it would at least be worth the search or even the use of soul speed.

Never actually knew this, wack.

That's kinda big dumb
Agreed i have unbreaking 3 netherite but it wears off ever second and a half please fix.

You have to go through so much effort for this enchantment. Then you can end up losing durability? It makes no sense. I also believe a speed buff needs to be added, because blue ice is so much easier to get, but it speeds you up more.

I think that soul speed should have a 1/3 chance do damage your boots without unbreaking, 1/6 chance to damage your boots with unbreaking 1, 1/9 chance to damage your boots with unbreaking 2, 1/12 chance to damage your boots with unbreaking 3.

I agree. It does cost durability of boots, and that's why I think it is fairly unreasonable that Mojang makes soul speed cost durability. As you mentioned, Frost Walker does not cost durability, and so does Depth Strider. Conclusively speaking, if Mojang hopes to maintain the balance of the game, it shoud not be working in this way(refer to letting Soul Speed cost the durability of boots). At least, the mechanism of specific enchantments, including Soul Speed, Swift Sneak, Depth Strider and Frost Walker, should be nearly the same, instead of changing mechanism of part of the enchantments as I mentioned above. Otherwise, the so-called "maintaining the balance of the game" will be a lie forever.

I like the idea. Carrots, Patatoes, and Sugar Cane can't grow normally in the Nether and could be cool as a house decoration. Though I do, however know you can grow wheat and turn mushrooms (both Brown and red) into giant mushrooms in the Nether because they don't require water to grow, like pumpkins and melons, it just takes a lot longer, just bring a lot of dirt or some mycelium, and blocks with a high blast resistance, to avoid them from being destroyed.
A block that you could put anywhere and you fill it with some grass or dirt and put some seeds (look : weird jar)
I think there should be a block that turns a small space into a terrarium, but not a space that is too big.
It should be a drop not craftable, something as powerful as this should be closely guarded not just craftable by anyone
I think it should go through as it is an amazing choice
This is a great idea! Netherite as it is is pretty rare, so this would make for an excellent end-game weapon!
Could be better as some kind of cannon. Maybe even as a handheld dispencer that also lets you use tnt, multiple fireworks? etc. No arrows though, since it's a cannon.

I think it'd be fun
I don't think minecraft needs another flower
There should be all colors of hibiscus and they should grow on skinny 2 block tall trees. The flowers could be sheared off to be used as decoration or cooked and eaten.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.

Totally agree with the idea of a new item for hoglins to drop. maybe even change the leather to something too just like rabbits hide. The disinfecting mechanic can be tricky but I do enjoy working with the piglins to get the item to be safer.

I definitely think this would make sense for a hoglin to drop. A creature living in the nether dropping porkchops don't seem right lol. Maybe have sowbelly meat sometimes be crispy, or burned, and take a little bit longer to eat to make it even more challenging. The nether should be harder to reside in than the overworld; therefore, not starving in this harsh realm is difficult. This would do the job.

This is a good idea! Hoglins can be very annoying at times and the reward you get for taking care of them is the equivalent of what a cow drops, just porkchops instead of beef. If I want food in the nether, I can take some cows and breed them there for the same amount of food and leather. I don't even have to go back to the overworld for wheat. I can use a block of dirt and turn it into farmland, get bonemeal from skeletons and wither skeletons, and bone meal the seeds a whole bunch until I have enough wheat to breed the cows. A new food item would make them more useful and unique to the nether. Plus isn't it kind of weird how PIGlins eat PORKchops?

I agree with the idea. Perhaps you don't need to wear a full set of gold armor? It would confuse new players as they wouldn't know what to do to get a Piglin to disinfect it. Otherwise very cool idea. Yeah some of the piglin's barters are important and useful but some of them aren't, and this would make piglin bartering more useful. (from what I am seeing you need to barter with the piglin again to refresh it's interest.)

Extra suggestion: Maybe have infected Sowbelly not give poison and hunger, but rather only weakness plus another new effect? This would make eating infected Sowbelly actually worth eating in early game nether only survival. Kinda like rotten flesh, in a way.

The cooked Sowbelly perhaps restores 10 hunger points (5 hunger bars), have more saturation than steak (but still not as much as golden carrots), takes a longer time to eat, and can also be eaten with full hunger.

Oh! What if you bring infected Sowbelly into the overworld for 15 seconds and it becomes decayed Sowbelly? As Hoglins zombify when going to the overworld, this would make a good continuity feature. decayed Sowbelly gives stronger negative effects than infected Sowbelly (Like wither, hunger and other new effects) and not even Piglins can disinfect it. In fact, Hoglins and Piglins are scared by it (like soul fire and warped fungi). Zoglins also drop decayed Sowbelly. (Disinfected and cooked Sowbelly is immune.)

The PMDMCG, your suggestions are amazing and they are perfect contributions! I agree that Infected Sowbelly giving poison and hunger is a bit harsh and it should act more like rotten flesh. Wearing a full set of golden armour would also be confusing for new players. There would be no way to figure that out other than searching it online. The stats for Cooked Sowbelly sound great as well!

The best feature you shared was the Decayed Sowbelly! I really like how one of the best food sources in the game can't be eaten in the overworld. Another reason to stay in the Nether! Decayed Sowbelly could give crazy effects like nausea, poison, weakness, and hunger. It would be a great continuity feature! 

Do you mind if I include some of your features for my post? I would be happy to credit you for your ideas, however, I understand if you chose not to as they are your ideas after all.
Amazing idea! This would be extremely useful!

This block could essentially be used as a limited one-way projectile block. A different name for this might be an Arrow Slit block. If placed within a wall, this would allow a player to shoot arrows through it freely. Perhaps it even fades to semitransparent when a player stands slightly within it (think the honey block and how it allows a player to stand slightly within it) to allow the player to see more targets. Alternatively, any player shooting from the other side must hit a very small area in the center of the block (think the archery target block and how it knows where it has been hit) in order for a projectile to pass through to the other side. Naturally, this would work with traps as well as clicking or attacking the arrow slit block would do nothing.

Of course, this would mean that several types of these would need to be available to cosmetically match the structure within which it was placed. Not sure how one would reconcile that.
This would work well for survival maps and PVP.
Traps would be more dangerous with this, as you couldn't just disable them by emptying the dispenser.

I don't think completely changing the stone variant for each biome is the best idea. It should instead be mixed in with that stone. So, for example, Deserts are Mostly stone, but with some sandstone and sand mixed in. Plains should be stone, cobblestone, and andesite. Snowy biomes: stone, cobblestone, ice, and mossy cobblestone. These are just a few suggestions. For this to be fair, these variants of stone should be able to craft items that now require just cobblestone, like, furnaces and pistons, or droppers and tools.

Maybe rather than having just granite or just sandstone, maybe vary the frequency? - like gold generating more in mesa, granite could generate more in jungles? I think this is what you were suggesting, and I like the idea of stone alternatives, but maybe the look changes? Granite furnaces? Diorite tools? I am aware that this already works with blackstone from the nether. Great idea!
It makes sense, there both nether bricks after all!
You can use a night vision potion.
this reminds of the post someone did on ghast peppers
This is a really good idea! Seems many people have great food ideas in mind for the nether update:
It would be cool to find some varient of melon or pumpkins in the nether. Maybe a soul fire jack'o'lantern or something for the new crops.
Maybe a bit less powerfull, more like just a bit more powerfull than endstone, still a great Idea thoe
I think that it shuld be a Iron block not a Iron bar.
Great idea that adds a use for iron. However if they ever add steel I would like the recipe changed to that.
Great ideia.Maybe with a little chage in the texture,if it still the same will looks like repeated blocks in the game.

This feature could be added by making concrete powder fall through iron bars (concrete powder placed above iron bars would fall down, occupying the same space as the bars) which would act as rebar, and once the concrete is set around the bars it would have a higher blast resistance. I made a post about this titled rebar/reinforced concrete.
rf3aruou

I support the idea that reinforced concrete should be made by letting concrete powder fall into iron bars and then solidify with water. This is a fun way to make building more realistic and rewarding and gives more use to iron bars. Also it should drop concrete and an iron nugget without silk touch.
